data.title: Great courts
data.text: Great outdoor courts and good facilities.  Cost rather high to reserve practice courts prior to tournament.

data.title: invitational playoffs March 20-22, 2015
data.text: The Surprise Tennis and Racquet complex has great tennis facilities, i.e. tennis courts, parking, courts are outstanding.  The place is really missing out on the food and beverages, no cafe, no restaurant, they do have a retain area for limited rackets but mostly tennis clothing.  Tennis players like to have a meal after the practice or a match, maybe even a beer or two to enjoy the post match social time.  Otherwise the courts are excellent.

data.title: Beautiful courts
data.text: We visited this club for a 2014 USTA League National Championship.  The 25 courts were new and clean and most of them were lit.  We had morning and afternoon matches and got to see the beautiful sunrise and sunset.  The temperature was pleasant and we only had one windy day out of the four days there in November.  A Holiday Inn and Marriott were within walking distance.

data.title: Concrete tennis courts in a very nice setting
data.text:
Talk about hard courts! Very nice setting, a few shady spots (would be nice if the viewing areas were shady). Some courts are soooo big that shagging balls is an effort that eats into your playing time. 
I played in the daytime where the sun was a blinding problem. If only Arizona was a little less sunny! I think playing at night is the way to go (the lighting capacity is appropriate). It was a great setting for a tournament.

As a player, I found the daytime brightness and the size of some of the courts made play difficult. The ball seemed to sail, and the sound of the racket on ball took some getting used to.

So generally, the nicest public club I have ever played at, but I would rather be in Vermont.

data.title: Tennis bluff
data.text: The city put them in a few years ago, and they are top notch. They hold the old timers event for the last several years. This allows us to see the oldtimers that we watch come up the ranks. It is a must place for tennis bluffs.

data.title: Good
data.text: I enrolled my son into their inexpensive tennis classes, the instructor was very attentive to the children. The place is very clean, and orderly. The staff should smile more, but we enjoyed our time there.

data.title: 2014 USTA Tennis Senior Nationals
data.text: A 25-court complex with ample bleachers and even a few picnic tables to allow seating for views of any court. There is a pro shop playing the Tennis Channel and selling tennis items as well as popsicles (I got the coconut one, and it was very sweet tasting) and a few chocolate concept ice creams -- nothing out of the ordinary. I actually managed to fall onto my hands out by the parking lot, and the tournament first aid station was not able to do much other than dab a little antibiotic cream (which I had to ask for) and wrap a gauze around the scrape. Luckily, our hotel had some disinfectant, and we were given directions to the nearby CVS to buy our own first aid items, including band-aids. These courts are all outdoors, and it rained a few times while I was there, play being discontinued as deemed necessary. There is one 'stadium court,' and there was always a doubles match in progress there. There is a grassy lot in the back of the complex where we had our players' party. A very clean and well-maintained tennis complex!

data.title: National Tournament
data.text:
Great tournament but the weather was really unpredicted
Great parking, beautiful courts and staff. USTA really did a great job in organizing tournament
